{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the earliest transient change following tissue injury. Transient changes are temporary and often occur immediately after an event, in this case, tissue injury. The options provided are all related to changes in different types of white blood cells. Neutrophilia refers to an increase in neutrophils, neutropenia refers to a decrease in neutrophils, monocytoses refers to an increase in monocytes, and lymphocytoses refers to an increase in lymphocytes.
